titleStmt.title: The case of the cross in baptism considered wherein is shewed that there is nothing in it as it is used in the Church of England that can be any just reason of separation from it.
titleStmt.author: Resbury, Nathanael, 1643-1711.

notesStmt.note: Written by Nathanael Resbury. Cf. BM.
This work also appears as the sixth item in v. 2 of: A collection of cases and other discources / by some divines of the city of London (Wing C5114).
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
